author: lathomas
body:
#### PR description:

This PR introduces a new skim selecting events based on the presence of a high pt well isolated/identified photon in the ECAL barrel, based on a similar HLT path (HLT_Photon110EB_TightID_TightIso). 
The saved data format is RAW-RECO. The primary purpose of the skim is to facilitate the calibration of L1 and HLT jets. 

#### PR validation:

The skim can be run with the following cmsDriver command: 

`cmsDriver.py SKIM --filein file:/afs/cern.ch/work/l/lathomas/public/SkimIsoPhotonEB/EGamma_RAW_run367902.root --fileout file:SKIM_IsoPhotonEB.root --nThreads 8 --no_exec --number 1000 --python_filename SKIM_IsoPhotonEB.py --scenario pp --step RAW2DIGI,L1Reco,RECO,SKIM:IsoPhotonEB --data --conditions 130X_dataRun3_Prompt_v3 --era Run3`

Running on 5000 events from the EGamma dataset (run 367902), I find 125 events passing the HLT path, out of which 85 pass the offline selection, resulting in 1.7% skim efficiency, comparable to what the ZElectron and ZMu skims achieve.
title: IsoPhotonEB RAW-RECO skim
